channel.title: Health Care
channel.description: News, Analysis and Opinion from POLITICO

item.title: Bill Gates appears in newly released photos from Epstein estate
item.description: The billionaire philanthropist has said his meetings with the late convicted sex offender were a mistake.

media:content.media:title: An undated photograph from Jeffrey Epstein's estate of Bill Gates and Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor released Dec. 12, 2025, by the House Oversight Committee as part of the Epstein files.

item.dc:creator: By Carmen Paun

item.title: Why Alaska’s GOP senators broke party lines on Obamacare
Democrats and Republicans have competing Obamacare plans. Here’s how they’d affect premiums.
What fraud? State Obamacare officials don’t see the problem GOP subsidy opponents do
item.description: State health care exchanges say they have few problems with fraud. Instead of killing the subsidies, policy experts suggest fixing the federal exchanges instead.

media:content.media:title: Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-La.) told POLITICO that his health savings account bill can help to combat fraud on Obamacare's insurance exchanges.

item.dc:creator: By Robert King

item.title: Trump still hasn’t endorsed a plan to avoid impending Obamacare hikes for millions
item.description: The Senate will vote Thursday on a key Republican health care plan, but its fate is uncertain, and Trump still hasn't endorsed any specific proposals.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump speaks during a roundtable discussion with business leaders in the Roosevelt Room of the White House, Dec. 10, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Cheyenne Haslett and Alex Gangitano
item.dc:contributor: By Cheyenne Haslett and Alex Gangitano

item.title: Health insurers ask GOP to fix their fraud problem — and extend Obamacare subsidies
item.description: In a last-minute plea, insurers are urging Republicans to crack down on fraud in their industry.

media:content.media:title: Health insurers say the expiration of enhanced Obamacare subsidies will force them to hike premiums for enrollees, given rising medical costs.

item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper

item.title: 3 Republican senators signal disapproval of HHS rule change seen as reducing transparency
Bill Cassidy is ready to cut a deal on Obamacare
item.description: The top Republican on health care also said he wants a vote this week on a GOP alternative to a Democratic bill to extend expiring subsidies.

media:content.media:description: Trump and Cassidy 'on the same page' on health care subsidies, senator says
media:content.media:title: Trump and Cassidy 'on the same page' on health care subsidies, senator says

item.dc:creator: By Carmen Paun and Robert King
item.dc:contributor: By Carmen Paun and Robert King

item.title: ‘Sort of blackmail’: Billions in rural health funding hinge on states passing Trump-backed policies
item.description: Democrats and health advocates described the strategy as highly unusual, and some fear it could be wielded to favor political allies.

media:content.media:title: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. speaks alongside President Donald Trump during an announcement about in vitro fertilization in the Oval Office on Oct. 16, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Alice Miranda Ollstein, Ruth Reader and Liz Crampton
item.dc:contributor: By Alice Miranda Ollstein, Ruth Reader and Liz Crampton

item.title: Congress struggles to unite behind a plan for Obamacare
item.description: Obamacare premiums will rise on Jan. 1 unless Congress acts.

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Bill Kuchman/POLITICO (source images via Getty Images)
media:content.media:title: Sens. Josh Hawley (R-Mo.), Chuck Schumer (D-NY), Bill Cassidy (R-La.) and Rick Scott (R-Fla.) are among the Congress members who have proposed changes for expiring Obamacare subsidies.

item.dc:creator: By Lauren Brensel

item.title: Trump asks RFK Jr. to ‘fast track’ vaccine schedule review
item.description: The president weighed in after the health secretary’s vaccine advisers recommended a major change to the shots routinely given to children.

media:content.media:title: Trump and Kennedy have long shared a view that American children get too many vaccines.

item.dc:creator: By Lauren Gardner

item.title: CDC vaccine panel chair compares team to 'puppets on a string'
item.description: The newly appointed chair’s comments were overheard Friday during a break in the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices’ proceedings.

media:content.media:title: Kirk Milhoan, the CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices’ said Friday he felt like committee members were “puppets on a string” rather than independent advisers.

item.dc:creator: By Lauren Gardner and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Lauren Gardner and Sophie Gardner

item.title: RFK Jr.'s vaccine panel says not all newborns need Hep B shots
item.description: The shot was previously recommended for all infants after birth to prevent an infection that can cause severe liver disease and cancer.

media:content.media:title: HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has remade the CDC's influential Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices.

item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner and Lauren Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Sophie Gardner and Lauren Gardner

item.title: CDC advisers delay vote at chaotic vaccine meeting
item.description: After last-minute changes, members complained they didn't fully understand what they were voting on.

media:content.media:title: The CDC's Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices, which includes vice chair Robert Malone, tabled a vote on the hepatitis B vaccine schedule.

item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: RFK Jr. ally, anti-vaccine lawyer to brief CDC vaccine meeting
item.description: Senate Health Committee Chair Bill Cassidy criticized the decision to invite Aaron Siri, who worked with Kennedy on vaccine-related lawsuits, to present at the CDC meeting.

media:content.media:title: Senate HELP Committee Chair Bill Cassidy (R-La.), who’s sparred with Kennedy over vaccine policy, questioned the CDC’s Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices' legitimacy on Thursday.

item.dc:creator: By Lauren Gardner

item.title: Obamacare fraud report has Republicans crying foul
item.description: The Government Accountability Office report is solidifying GOP opposition to extending expiring subsidies that help people pay for health insurance.

media:content.media:title: House Ways and Means Chair Jason Smith said the report was a "smoking gun."

item.dc:creator: By Robert King

item.title: Why Republicans aren’t eager to cut an Obamacare deal
item.description: “No one wants a primary challenge where the accusation is: ‘You supported Obamacare.’”

media:content.media:title: House Speaker Mike Johnson, flanked by Reps. Lisa McClain (R-Mich.), Zach Nunn (R-Iowa), Steve Scalise (R-La.) and Tom Emmer (R-Minn.), calls on a reporter during a press conference at Republican National Committee headquarters on Capitol Hill, Dec. 2, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Alice Miranda Ollstein and Robert King
item.dc:contributor: By Alice Miranda Ollstein and Robert King

item.title: Lobbyists are salivating for more of Trump’s drug price deals
item.description: Advocates for European drugmakers say other countries must follow the UK to the bargaining table to stave off tariffs and remain competitive.

media:content.media:title: President Trump has taken a hard line with foreign leaders, like European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, on pharma tariffs.

item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu

item.title: The FDA’s top drug regulator submits his resignation to the agency
item.description: Food and Drug Administration chief Marty Makary convinced Rick Pazdur to take the role to help bring stability to the roiling agency.

media:content.media:title: Rick Pazdur, a 26-year agency veteran, initially rebuffed efforts by Makary to convince him to assume leadership of the FDA’s Center for Drug Evaluation and Research.

item.dc:creator: By Lauren Gardner and David Lim
item.dc:contributor: By Lauren Gardner and David Lim

item.title: Doctors call Ozempic a miracle drug. Medicaid officials aren’t so sure.
item.description: States are choosing not to cover the new weight-loss drugs, sacrificing a chance to stem cancer, diabetes and heart disease.

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Claudine Hellmuth/POLITICO (source images via iStock)
media:content.media:title: Main.Hooper.MedicaidObesityDrugs.jpg

item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper

item.title: RFK Jr. is overhauling the program that helps preserve Americans' access to vaccines
item.description: A Kennedy adviser said he wants to preserve the Vaccine Injury Compensation Program. The health secretary's anti-vaccine allies prefer it collapse.

media:content.media:title: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. arrives to testify during a Senate Finance Committee hearing on "The President's 2026 Health Care Agenda" on September 4.

item.dc:creator: By Lauren Gardner

item.title: Americans are buckling under medical bills. It could get worse.
item.description: Charities that help people pay for care say demand is way up. That’s before scheduled Medicaid and Obamacare cuts take effect.

media:content.media:title: A new POLITICO poll found nearly half of Americans are struggling with medical bills.

item.dc:creator: By Amanda Chu

item.title: Trump opens the door to Obamacare subsidy extension
item.description: The president said an extension of subsidies that help people pay for health insurance "may be necessary" to buy time for a broader overhaul.

media:content.media:title: The White House had earlier this week floated a two-year extension, but President Donald Trump told reporters Tuesday he didn't support that.

item.dc:creator: By Cheyenne Haslett and Sophie Gardner
item.dc:contributor: By Cheyenne Haslett and Sophie Gardner

item.title: Trump’s CMS touts $12B savings from Medicare drug price negotiations
item.description: The second round of Inflation Reduction Act negotiation prices, which includes 15 brand-name drugs, will kick into effect in 2027.

media:content.media:title: Dr. Mehmet Oz testifies during a Senate confirmation hearing March 14, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By David Lim

item.title: Obamacare premiums are skyrocketing. Republicans can’t figure out what to do.
item.description: GOP lawmakers knew subsidies were expiring and premiums would spike, but no clear, conservative alternative emerged.

media:content.media:title: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) speaks during a press conference at the U.S. Capitol, Nov. 19, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Robert King and Simon J. Levien
item.dc:contributor: By Robert King and Simon J. Levien

item.title: RFK Jr. says he directed CDC to remove claim that vaccines do not cause autism
item.description: The HHS secretary said in an interview he ordered the CDC’s website to acknowledge gaps in studies on vaccines and autism.

media:content.media:title: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. speaks during the Western Governors’ Association meeting on Nov. 20 in Scottsdale, Arizona.

item.dc:creator: By Aaron Pellish

item.title: The White House has asked for the resignation of a top aide to FDA chief
item.description: Commissioner Marty Makary is pushing back on the demand, officials told POLITICO, in the latest development to roil the agency

media:content.media:title: Food and Drug Administration Commissioner Marty Makary speaks alongside President Donald Trump during an annoucement about in vitro fertilization in the Oval Office at the White House Oct. 16, 2025,

item.dc:creator: By Lauren Gardner

item.title: Inside the CDC whiplash
item.description: Workers at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention told POLITICO that they’re grappling with lack of communication from the top, leadership vacancies and stalled progress – and the worry that they’ll soon again be fired. HHS disputes their concerns.

media:content.media:title: People participate in a candlelight vigil in front of the main offices of the Centers for Disease Control on March 28, 2025, in Atlanta.

item.dc:creator: By Sophie Gardner

item.title: Looming affordability crisis set to hit Americans with health insurance through work
item.description: It’s a perilous combination for 165 million people with employer-sponsored health insurance. Premiums are rising, while yearly pay raises shrink.

media:content.media:title: Polling has shown that health care affordability is among the top issues American voters hope Congress will address.

item.dc:creator: By Kelly Hooper

item.title: Obamacare customers with sky-high premiums will get no help through Cassidy’s plan, Democrats and policy experts say
item.description: With the enhanced subsidies set to expire at the end of the year, Democrats say they see no choice but to extend them.

media:content.media:title: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee Chair Bill Cassidy (R-La.) speaks during a hearing on Capitol Hill, on Sept. 17, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Robert King
